info.question: Security groups act like a firewall at the instance level whereas ___ are an additional layer of security that act at the subnet level?
How many VPC's am I allowed in each AWS Region by default?
VPC stands for?
How many internet gateways can I attach to my custom VPC?

You have a VPC with both public and private subnets. You have 3 EC2 instances that have been deployed in to the public subnet and each has internet access. You deploy a 4th instance using the same AMI and this instance does not have internet access. What could be the cause of this?
answers: The instance needs a private route out to the internet.
The instance needs either an Elastic IP address/Public IP address assigned to it.
The instance's security group is preventing it from connecting to the internet.
The ACL of the subnet is preventing access to the internet.
correctAnswer: The instance needs either an Elastic IP address/Public IP address assigned to it.

info.question: A VPC Flow Log allows you to do which?
answers: capture information about the eip traffic going to and from network interfaces in your VPC
capture information about the messages going to and from your applications in your EC2 instances in your VPC
capture log information about your VPC
capture log information about the EC2 instances in your VPC
correctAnswer: capture information about the eip traffic going to and from network interfaces in your VPC

info.question: VPC Flow log data is stored _____?
answers: on the EC2 instance EBS volumes

info.question: After you've created a VPC Flow log, you can retrieve its data from the ________?
answers: S3 bucket in which they're stored
from the EC2 instance EBS volumes

info.question: VPC Flow logs can be created at three levels?
You can stream your VPC Flow logs to which of these?
You can _________ from your VPC Flow logs streamed to Lambda or ElasticSearch?
You can _________ from your VPC Flow logs streamed to Lambda or ElasticSearch?
You can't enable flow logs for VPCs that are peered with your VPC unless the peer VPC _______?
You can tag a VPC Flow Log?
After you've created a VPC Flow Log, you can change its configuration?
All ip traffic is monitored in a VPC Flow Log?
IP traffic generated by instances when they contact the Amazon DNS server is captured by your VPC Flow Log?
IP traffic generated by instances when they contact your own (created by you) DNS server is captured by your VPC Flow Log?
IP traffic generated by a Windows instance for an Amazon Windows license activation is captured by your VPC Flow Log?
IP traffic to and from 169.254.169.254 for instance meta data is captured by your VPC Flow Log?
DHCP traffic is captured by your VPC Flow Log?
Traffic to the reserved ip address for the default VPC router is captured by your VPC Flow Log?
A NAT Instance is used to provide internet traffic to EC2 instances in ________?
A NAT Instance is used to provide internet traffic to EC2 instances in a private subnet for things like __________?
answers: sending traffic to your database EC2 instance
sending traffic to your application server EC2 instance
sending traffic to your web server EC2 instance

info.question: A Bastion Host is used to ________ EC2 instances in private subnets?
There are two different types of VPC endpoints?
Interface VPC endpoints _______?
answers: are an ENI attached to your EC2 instances which serves as a point of entry for traffic to your private subnet EC2 instances
serve as a target for a route in your route table for traffic destined for your EC2 instances
correctAnswer: are an ENI attached to your EC2 instances which serves as a point of entry for traffic to your private subnet EC2 instances

info.question: Gateway VPC endpoints _______?
answers: are an ENI attached to your EC2 instances which serves as a point of entry for traffic to your private subnet EC2 instances
serve as a target for a route in your route table for traffic destined for your EC2 instances
correctAnswer: serve as a target for a route in your route table for traffic destined for your EC2 instances

info.question: Gateway VPC endpoints _______?
answers: are an ENI attached to your EC2 instances which serves as a point of entry for traffic to your private subnet EC2 instances
serve as a target for a route in your route table for traffic destined for your EC2 instances
correctAnswer: serve as a target for a route in your route table for traffic destined for your EC2 instances

info.question: When creating a NAT Instance, you need to ______?
answers: disable the Source/Destination check on the instance
assign a DNS name to the NAT Instance
assign an ip address to the NAT Instance
correctAnswer: disable the Source/Destination check on the instance

info.question: With a NAT Instance, you need to ______?
answers: place the NAT Instance in a public subnet
place the NAT Instance in a private subnet
assign an ip address to the NAT Instance
correctAnswer: place the NAT Instance in a public subnet

info.question: With a NAT Instance, there must be a route out of the private subnet to the NAT Instance?
If you are experiencing bottlenecking with your NAT Instance, ________?
answers: increase the size of the NAT Instance
add more EBS volumes to the NAT Instance
switch the NAT Instance to a Bastion Host
correctAnswer: increase the size of the NAT Instance

info.question: To make your NAT Instance highly available you can do which?
answers: use multiple subnets in different AZs
correctAnswer: use multiple subnets in different AZs

info.question: NAT Instances are _________?
Which is the preferred solution these days?
NAT Gateways scale __________?
NAT Gateways are associated with Security Groups?
NAT Gateways are automatically assigned a _________?
After you create a NAT Gateway you need to _________?
answers: associate it with an EC2 instance
associate it with a Security Group
